pullRequest.body:
Generalizes the previous definition and moves it into `LinearAlgebra/BilinearMap`.

bors d+

```suggestion
def restrictScalars (B : M [R] N [S] P) : M [R'] N [S'] P :=
  LinearMap.mk' R' S'
    (fun x y  B x y)
    (by intros; simp only [map_add, LinearMap.add_apply])
    (by intros; simp only [LinearMap.map_smul_of_tower, LinearMap.smul_apply])
    (fun x  map_add (B x))
    (fun _ x  (B x).map_smul_of_tower _)
```

```suggestion
theorem restrictScalars_inj {B B' : M [R] N [S] P} :
```
This is probably overkill; `IsScalarTower S' S N` and `IsScalarTower S' S P` would be easier to understand, and the only difference is `int`-bilinear maps over semirings which I doubt we care about.
done
My understanding was that the `M` and `N` variables were only supposed to be used for semilinear maps. Can you add `` suffixes?
No, `M` and `N` are generally used, the subscript `l` is for cases where you need less assumptions, but that is not true here.

I didn't understand that from the comment on line 37:
> -- the `` subscript variables are for special cases about linear (as opposed to semilinear) maps

On the other hand, that seems to be the general approach since leanprover-community/mathlib#10373 e.g. the definition of `mk'`. So this is okay with me.

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion B.restrictScalars R' S' x y = B x y := rfl ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion B.restrictScalars R' S' x y = B x y := rfl ```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion B.restrictScalars R' S' x y = B x y := rfl ```
I now realize that I PR'd a (less general) version of this already as `LinearMap.restrictScalars` in #10167 (so-named to match `LinearMap.compl`). Can you remove my version in this PR too?
I think we should probably still call it `restrictScalars`
I assume my previous `(f.flip.restrictScalars _).flip.restrictScalars _` implementation no longer works?
No, this requires weird instances that totally unnecessary.

```suggestion
variable (R' S' : Type*)
```
I guess this is an old PR

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion rw [ smul_one_smul R r' m, map_smul, smul_one_smul]) ```
`@[simps]` can autogenerate this but it will be called `_apply_apply`. Is that the reason for manually defining the lemma?
I think I'd be inclined to keep the `_apply_apply` name anyway
